title: Bastille
summary: The Bastille (/bæˈstiːl/, French: [bastij] (listen)) was a fortress in Paris, known formally as the Bastille Saint-Antoine. It played an important role in the internal conflicts of France and for most of its history was used as a state prison by the kings of France. It was stormed by a crowd on 14 July 1789, in the French Revolution, becoming an important symbol for the French Republican movement.  It was later demolished and replaced by the Place de la Bastille.
